*div1 type="summary"* *p*J. E. B. Austin to Austin, March 18, 1829. Coasting trade. Popular discontent with local government. Popularity of Austin.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Brasoria */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="03-18-1829">March 18th. 1829*/date_mentioned*—*/p* *p*Dr *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*The Eclipse sailed *date_mentioned n="03-18-1829">this morning*/date_mentioned**location_mentioned* from the mouth of the river*/location_mentioned* and you may expect her by the*date_mentioned n="04-20-1829"> 20th of next*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*The Little Zoe arrived to-day from *location_mentioned*N. Orleans*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Dr Gibson */person_mentioned*came out with the intention of becoming a permanent Settler in the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned**person_mentioned*John */person_mentioned*thinks *person_mentioned*Mr Williams*/person_mentioned* is mistaken in regard to the Seal necessary for a clearance, the Patente or register—may perhaps require a $6. Seal but the registro or clearance is obliged to be on one—however as he tells me the *person_mentioned*Consul */person_mentioned*at *location_mentioned*Matamoros*/location_mentioned*, informed him that Seldom two clearances were given alike—I anticipate no difficulty on that head—*/p*
*p*I came by the *location_mentioned*Fort Settlement*/location_mentioned* and used my influence to push the *location_mentioned*Academy */location_mentioned*forward but I am sorry to say I did not find one *person_mentioned*advocate*/person_mentioned* for it—Not because they were opposed to [it] altogether but owing to the hands the funds for that purpose will be deposited in. I find the*person_mentioned* Members of the Ayuntamiento*/person_mentioned* unpopular throughout the *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*. They all appear willing to subscribe for a *location_mentioned*Jail */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Academy */location_mentioned* provided a committee of responsible men be appointed to receive the subscriptions, but as the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamiento */person_mentioned*is a changeable body they are opposed to their having anything to do with it. Again, I find something must be done as regards the admission of *person_mentioned*Lawyers */person_mentioned*in the *person_mentioned*Alcaldy Court*/person_mentioned* the people to a man are opposed to them, they evince no disposition to be violent, or resort to violent measures but they are determined to have them dismissed from the practice, and the measure that they are about adopting is to mildly petition the *person_mentioned*Alcalde*/person_mentioned*, to dismiss them altogether from the practice of law—*/p*
*p*the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*think that justice is often very lamely administered by the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*owing to the perplexity he incurs by hearing lengthy and contending arguments, that frequently have no bearing to the case in discussion—Also another grievance they complain of is this— frequently a suit for a small amt is brought before the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*where one or both of the *person_mentioned*parties */person_mentioned*reside in another district, the *person_mentioned*sheriff */person_mentioned*is sent with a process—and costs are accumulated to an amt that thribble the principal, the question is asked what are the *person_mentioned*Commissaryos*/person_mentioned* appointed for in the different *location_mentioned*districts*/location_mentioned*, if these things could be remedied, I think the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*would remain quiet for a while—at least untill they had another hobby to stride—Yourself it seems, at present, is the polar Star, and the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*look to you, and confide in you to a man, to put matters to rights—I may say with propriety that you are at present the *person_mentioned*most popular man in the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, and Your opinion will have more weight with the people generally than all the clamour that now goes abroad.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John */person_mentioned*informs me that *person_mentioned*Mr Smith the consul at *location_mentioned*Matamoros*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, intimated to him that he wished to appoint a *person_mentioned*Vice Consul*/person_mentioned* for this- *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*and he stated to *person_mentioned*Mr Smith*/person_mentioned* that perhaps I would accept the appointment—and took the liberty of proposing me to him—I should be willing to accept the appointment, and You will please write to him on the Subject by the first opportunity lest some one else may procure it—as I am informed one or two applications have been already made to him on the subject.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Elisa */person_mentioned*and the *person_mentioned*Boy */person_mentioned*are well and wish to be rememberd*/p* *p* *person_mentioned*J B Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
